item.title: Australia offers U.S. a vast new military launchpad in China conflict
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: Australia is expanding its northern military bases, with U.S. support, to counter China's growing threat. Critics quip it’s become the “51st state.”

item.title: South Koreans once chipped in for fighter jets. Now, they make their own.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee
item.description: The U.S. Phantom F-4 fighter jet, which South Korea has just retired from use, acts as a metaphor for the countries’ security alliance. It’s also a hell of a ride.

item.title: At least 3 killed, 8 injured in knife attack at German festival, police say
item.dc:creator: Steffi Hentschke, Sammy Westfall, Frances Vinall
item.description: The attack occurred late Friday in the western city of Solingen. Police are searching for an unknown assailant, and a local official urged against speculation.

item.title: U.S. debates support for Ukraine’s surprise offensive into Russia
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Alex Horton, Isabelle Khurshudyan
item.description: Caught unaware by Ukraine’s military incursion into Russia, the Biden administration is debating whether to help Kyiv’s forces hold the sliver of territory they now occupy.

item.title: U.S. calls Lopez Obrador reforms ‘major risk’ to democracy; Mexico protests
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: The Mexican president Lopez Obrador rejects U.S. criticism about his radical judicial reform. The dispute comes as the U.S. is relying on Mexico to contain migration during a presidential campaign.

item.title: U.S. insists Gaza cease-fire deal is close, but diplomats are skeptical
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Steve Hendrix, Heba Farouk Mahfouz
item.description: U.S. officials have insisted that negotiations for a cease-fire in Gaza were making headway, while glossing over intense disagreements between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: India’s Modi visits Ukraine, urges Zelensky to hold peace talks
item.dc:creator: Gerry Shih
item.description: The Indian prime minister’s trip to the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, came after his visit to Moscow last month, which was sharply criticized by Zelensky.

item.title: Last chance to escape: Ukrainians flee Pokrovsk as Russians advance
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Tetiana Burianova, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: As Ukrainian soldiers struggle to stave off waves of Russian fighters, civilians flee Pokrovsk, a city once thought far from the front line.

item.title: Icelandic volcano eruption sends lava flowing in visual spectacle
item.dc:creator: Justine McDaniel
item.description: The eruption, the sixth on the Reykjanes Peninsula since December, created a glow that attracted attention but did not pose a threat to residents.

item.title: How many hostages are still in Gaza since Hamas attack on Israel? What to know.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Sammy Westfall, Helier Cheung
item.description: Israel estimates some 116 hostages held by Hamas have been released or freed; 71 are believed still to be alive in Gaza. Here’s what we know.

item.title: Final body found in Sicily yacht wreckage is Hannah Lynch, official says
item.dc:creator: Stefano Pitrelli, Adela Suliman
item.description: The 18-year-old daughter of British tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch was the last passenger missing from Monday’s sinking of the Bayesian.

item.title: Kamala Harris spotlights her mom and dad in DNC speech: About her parents
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: Kamala Harris’s DNC speech credited her mom Shyamala Gopalan and dad Donald Harris, who immigrated from India and Jamaica respectively, with shaping her identity.

item.title: Harris strikes balance in pointed DNC remarks on war
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Yasmeen Abutaleb
item.description: The Democratic presidential nominee said she would “always stand up for Israel’s right to defend itself,” but also directly addressed the suffering in Gaza.

item.title: The strategy behind Ukraine’s move into Russia
item.dc:creator: Bishop Sand, Monica Campbell, Reena Flores, Sean Carter, Rennie Svirnovskiy, Ali Bianco, Emma Talkoff
item.description: In recent weeks, Ukraine launched a surprise attack into Russia, taking land and capturing Russian prisoners of war. Today, The Post’s Ukraine bureau chief, Isabelle Khurshudyan, explains how Ukraine’s incursion may change the trajectory of the war.

item.title: As Hezbollah and Israel step up attacks, ailing Lebanon fears the worst
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: In Lebanon’s impoverished south, where Hezbollah holds sway and attacks have been most intense, Syrian refugees have borne the brunt of the recent violence.

item.title: Mike Lynch’s body is fifth found in yacht wreckage; daughter is last missing
item.dc:creator: Stefano Pitrelli, Adela Suliman
item.description: The body of Lynch, 59, was recovered from the wreckage of the Bayesian, according to an Italian government official. The Bayesian yacht sank in a storm this week.

item.title: Ukrainians cheer push into Russia but fear it comes at the cost of the east
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Anastacia Galouchka, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: As Moscow’s forces gain ground in Ukraine’s east, some are questioning why Kyiv is devoting so many resources to taking Russian land rather than defending its own.

item.title: Israeli military says recovered hostages’ bodies had gunshot wounds
item.dc:creator: Hazem Balousha, Shira Rubin, Lior Soroka, Sammy Westfall, Frances Vinall
item.description: Six bodies of Israeli hostages being held by Hamas in Gaza were recovered on Tuesday from a tunnel below Khan Younis.

item.title: Russia opens case against CNN reporter who covered Kursk incursion
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: The country’s security service said the journalist would be placed on Russia’s wanted list. Under Russian law, the maximum penalty for illegally crossing the border is five years in prison.

item.title: Second-largest diamond ever, 2,492 carats, unearthed in Botswana
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Lucara Diamond discovered the world's second largest diamond in Botswana's Karowe mine using Mega Diamond Recovery X-ray technology.

item.title: New arrests in smuggling of migrants who died in a Texas truck
item.dc:creator: Arelis R. Hernández, Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: Guatemalan officials announced the dismantling of a smuggling ring behind the deadliest incident of its kind on U.S. soil, in which 53 migrants died.

item.title: How many women presidents and prime ministers have served in your lifetime?
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Dylan Moriarty
item.description: The U.S. has never had a woman president, but it’s far from alone. Enter your birthday to find out the number of women who have led around the world.

item.title: Who was Mike Lynch, the British tech entrepreneur in superyacht sinking?
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Adela Suliman
item.description: The software millionaire was once considered Britain’s version of Bill Gates. The yacht trip followed his acquittal on U.S. fraud charges related to a tech deal.
